Ability Capsule.effect: A capsule that allows a Pokemon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used.

Ability Urge.effect: When used, it activates the Ability of an ally Pokemon.

Abomasite.effect: Enables Abomasnow to Mega Evolve during battle.

Absolite.effect: Enables Absol to Mega Evolve during battle.

Absorb Bulb.effect: A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit by a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk will rise.

Adamant Orb.effect: Increases the power of Dragon-​ and Steel-type moves when held by Dialga.

Adventure Rules.effect: This book contains all the points a new Trainer needs to know on a journey. It was handmade by a kind friend.

Aerodactylite.effect: Enables Aerodactyl to Mega Evolve during battle.

Aggronite.effect: Enables Aggron to Mega Evolve during battle.

Aguav Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Air Balloon.effect: When held by a Pokemon, the Pokemon will float into the air. When the holder is attacked, this item will burst.

Alakazite.effect: Enables Alakazam to Mega Evolve during battle.

Ampharosite.effect: Enables Ampharos to Mega Evolve during battle.

Amulet Coin.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It doubles a battle’s prize money if the holding Pokemon joins in.

Antidote.effect: A spray-type medicine. It lifts the effect of poison from one Pokemon.

Apicot Berry.effect: Raises Special Defense when HP is low.

Armor Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokemon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a collar.

Aspear Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it defrosts it.

Awakening.effect: A spray-type medicine. It awakens a Pokemon from the clutches of sleep.

Babiri Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Steel-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

BalmMushroom.effect: A rare mushroom which gives off a nice fragrance. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Banettite.effect: Enables Banette to Mega Evolve during battle.

Belue Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Berry Juice.effect: A 100% pure juice made of Berries. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by just 20 points.

Big Mushroom.effect: A large and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

Big Nugget.effect: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Big Pearl.effect: A quite-large pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

Big Root.effect: Recovers more HP from HP-stealing moves.

Binding Band.effect: A band that increases the power of binding moves when held.

Black Belt.effect: Increases the power of Fighting-type moves.

Black Flute.effect: A toy flute made from black glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Black Sludge.effect: A held item that gradually restores the HP of Poison-type Pokemon. It inflicts damage on all other types.

BlackGlasses.effect: Increases the power of Dark-type moves.

Blastoisinite.effect: Enables Blastoise to Mega Evolve during battle.

Blazikenite.effect: Enables Blaziken to Mega Evolve during battle.

Blk Apricorn.effect: A black Apricorn It has an indescribable scent.

Blu Apricorn.effect: A blue Apricorn. It smells a bit like grass.

Blue Flute.effect: A toy flute made from blue glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Blue Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Beauty aspect in a Contest.

Blue Shard.effect: A small blue shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

Bluk Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Bug Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Bug-type move only once.

Burn Drive.effect: Changes Techno Blast to a Fire-type move when held by Genesect.

Burn Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine. It heals a single Pokemon that is suffering from a burn.

Calcium.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base Sp. Atk (Special Attack) stat of a single Pokemon.

Carbos.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base Speed stat of a single Pokemon.

Casteliacone.effect: Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve ice cream. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokemon.

Cell Battery.effect: A consumable battery. If the holder is hit by an Electric-type move, its Attack will rise.

Charcoal.effect: Increases the power of Fire-type moves.

Charizardite X.effect: Enables Charizard to Mega Evolve during battle.

Charizardite Y.effect: Enables Charizard to Mega Evolve during battle.

Charti Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Rock-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Cheri Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from paralysis.

Cherish Ball.effect: A quite rare Poke Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

Chesto Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from sleep.

Chilan Berry.effect: Weakens a Normal-type attack against the Pokemon holding this berry.

Chill Drive.effect: Changes Techno Blast to an Ice-type move when held by Genesect.

Choice Band.effect: Raises Attack, but only one move can be used.

Choice Scarf.effect: Raises Speed, but only one move can be used.

Choice Specs.effect: Raises Special Attack, but only one move can be used.

Chople Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Fighting-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Claw Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a claw.

Cleanse Tag.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It helps keep wild Pokemon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

Coba Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Flying-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Colbur Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Dark-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Colress Machine.effect: A special device that wrings out the potential of Pokemon. It is an imperfect prototype.

Comet Shard.effect: A shard which fell to the ground when a comet approached. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Cornn Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Cover Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that lived in the sea in ancient times. It appears to be part of its back.

Custap Berry.effect: Holder can move first when HP is low.

Damp Mulch.effect: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Damp Rock.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of the move Rain Dance used by the holder.

Dark Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Dark-type move only once.

Dawn Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokemon evolve. It sparkles like eyes.

DeepSeaScale.effect: Increases Special Defense when held by Clamperl.

DeepSeaTooth.effect: Increases Special Attack when held by Clamperl.

Destiny Knot.effect: A long, thin, bright-red string to be held by a Pokemon. If the holder becomes infatuated, the foe does too.

Dire Hit.effect: Raises critical-hit ratio of a Pokemon in battle.

Dire Hit 2.effect: It can be used many times to raise the critical-hit ratio of one Pokemon. It wears off if the Pokemon is withdrawn.

Dire Hit 3.effect: It can be used many times to greatly raise a Pokemon’s critical-hit ratio. It wears off if the Pokemon is withdrawn.

Dive Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that works especially well on Pokemon that live underwater.

DNA Splicers.effect: A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a certain Pokemon. They are said to have been one in the beginning.

Dome Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a shell.

Douse Drive.effect: Changes Techno Blast to a Water-type move when held by Genesect.

Draco Plate.effect: Increases power of Dragon-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Dragon.

Dragon Fang.effect: Increases the power of Dragon-type moves.

Dragon Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Dragon-type move only once.

Dragon Scale.effect: A thick and tough scale. Dragon-type Pokemon may be holding this item when caught.

Dread Plate.effect: Increases power of Dark-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Dark.

Dream Ball.effect: A special Poke Ball that appears out of nowhere in a bag at the Entree Forest. It can catch any Pokemon.

Dropped Item.effect: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City amusement park. It seems it belongs to a boy.

Dubious Disc.effect: A transparent device overflowing with dubious data. Its producer is unknown.

Durin Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Dusk Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokemon at night or in dark places like caves.

Dusk Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokemon evolve. It is as dark as dark can be.

Earth Plate.effect: Increases power of Ground-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ground.

Eject Button.effect: If the holder is hit by an attack, it will switch with another Pokemon in your party.

Electirizer.effect: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric energy. It is loved by a certain Pokemon.

Electric Gem.effect: Increases the power of an Electric-type move only once.

Elevator Key.effect: A card key that activates the elevator in Lysandre Labs. It is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.

Elixir.effect: It restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokemon by 10 points each.

Energy Root.effect: A very bitter root. It restores the HP of one POKeMON by 200 points.

EnergyPowder.effect: A very bitter medicine powder. It restores the HP of one POKeMON by 50 points.

Enigma Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it restores its HP if it is hit by any supereffective attack.

Escape Rope.effect: A long, durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

Ether.effect: It restores the PP of a Pokemon’s selected move by a maximum of 10 points.

Everstone.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The Pokemon holding this peculiar stone is prevented from evolving.

Eviolite.effect: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When held, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def of a Pokemon that can still evolve.

Exp. Share.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The holder gets a share of a battle’s Exp. Points without battling.

Expert Belt.effect: Increases the power of super-effective moves.

Fairy Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Fairy-type move only once.

Fast Ball.effect: A Poke Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokemon which are quick to run away.

Fighting Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Fighting-type move only once.

Figy Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Fire Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Fire-type move only once.

Fire Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of POKeMON evolve. It is colored orange.

Fist Plate.effect: Increases power of Fighting-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fighting.

Flame Orb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is a bizarre orb that inflicts a burn on the holder in battle.

Flame Plate.effect: Increases power of Fire-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fire.

Float Stone.effect: A very light stone. It reduces the weight of a Pokemon when held.

Fluffy Tail.effect: An item that attracts Pokemon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokemon.

Flying Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Flying-type move only once.

Focus Band.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The holder may endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

Focus Sash.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. If it has full HP, the holder will endure one potential KO attack, leaving 1 HP.

Fresh Water.effect: Water with a high mineral content. It restores the HP of one POKeMON by 50 points.

Friend Ball.effect: A Poke Ball that makes caught Pokemon more friendly.

Full Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokemon.

Full Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is an exotic-smelling incense that makes the holder bloated and slow moving.

Full Restore.effect: A medicine that fully restores the HP and heals any status problems of a single Pokemon.

Ganlon Berry.effect: Raises Defense when HP is low.

Garchompite.effect: Enables Garchomp to Mega Evolve during battle.

Gardevoirite.effect: Enables Gardevoir to Mega Evolve during battle.

Gengarite.effect: Enables Gengar to Mega Evolve during battle.

Ghost Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Ghost-type move only once.

Gooey Mulch.effect: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Grass Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Grass-type move only once.

Great Ball.effect: A good, high-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokemon catch rate than a standard Poke Ball.

Green Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Smart aspect in a Contest.

Green Shard.effect: A small green shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

Grepa Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base Sp. Def stat.

Grip Claw.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of multiturn attacks like Bind and Wrap.

Griseous Orb.effect: Increases the power of Dragon- and Ghost-type moves when held by Giratina, and changes it to Origin Forme.

Grn Apricorn.effect: A green Apricorn. It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

Ground Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Ground-type move only once.

Growth Mulch.effect: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Grubby Hanky.effect: A handkerchief dropped by a regular at Cafe Warehouse. It smells faintly like a Pokemon.

Guard Spec..effect: Prevents stat reduction for five turns.

Gyaradosite.effect: Enables Gyarados to Mega Evolve during battle.

Haban Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Dragon-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Hard Stone.effect: Increases the power of Rock-type moves.

Heal Ball.effect: A remedial Poke Ball that restores the caught Pokemon’s HP and eliminates any status problem.

Heal Powder.effect: A very bitter medicine powder. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokemon.

Heart Scale.effect: A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is extremely rare. It glows faintly in the colors of the rainbow.

Heat Rock.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of the move Sunny Day used by the holder.

Heavy Ball.effect: A Poke Ball for catching very heavy Pokemon.

Helix Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a seashell.

Heracronite.effect: Enables Heracross to Mega Evolve during battle.

HM05.effect: Teaches the move Flash / Defog / Whirlpool / Waterfall.

HM06.effect: Teaches the move Whirlpool / Rock Smash / Dive.

HM08.effect: Teaches the move Dive / Rock Climb.

Holo Caster.effect: A device that allows users to receive and view hologram clips at any time. It is also used to chat with others.

Hondew Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base Sp. Atk stat.

Honey.effect: A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild Pokemon when it is used in grass, caves, or on special trees.

Honor Of Kalos.effect: A precious symbol that is awarded only to an individual who has done great things for the Kalos region.

Houndoominite.effect: Enables Houndoom to Mega Evolve during battle.

HP Up.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base HP of a single Pokemon.

Hyper Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by 200 points.

Iapapa Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Ice Gem.effect: Increases the power of an Ice-type move only once.

Ice Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine. It defrosts a Pokemon that has been frozen solid.

Icicle Plate.effect: Increases power of Ice-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ice.

Icy Rock.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of the move Hail used by the holder.

Insect Plate.effect: Increases power of Bug-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Bug.

Intriguing Stone.effect: A rather curious stone that might appear to be valuable to some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

Iron.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base Defense stat of a single Pokemon.

Iron Ball.effect: A Pokemon held item that cuts Speed. It makes Flying-type and levitating holders susceptible to Ground moves.

Iron Plate.effect: Increases power of Steel-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Steel.

Item Drop.effect: When used, it causes an ally Pokemon to drop a held item.

Item Urge.effect: When used, it causes an ally Pokemon to use its held item.

Jaboca Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon and a physical attack lands, the attacker also takes damage.

Kangaskhanite.effect: Enables Kangaskhan to Mega Evolve during battle.

Kasib Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ghost-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Kebia Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Poison-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Kelpsy Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base Attack stat.

King's Rock.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. When the holder inflicts damage, the target may flinch.

Lagging Tail.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is tremendously heavy and makes the holder move slower than usual.

Lansat Berry.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when HP is low.

Lava Cookie.effect: LAVARIDGE TOWN’s local specialty. It heals all the status problems of one POKeMON.

Lax Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The tricky aroma of this incense may make attacks miss the holder.

Leaf Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of POKeMON evolve. It has a leaf pattern.

Leftovers.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The holder’s HP is gradually restored during battle.

Lemonade.effect: A very sweet drink. It restores the HP of one POKeMON by 80 points.

Lens Case.effect: A rather chic-looking case for carrying contact lenses.

Leppa Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it restores a move’s PP by 10.

Level Ball.effect: A Poke Ball for catching Pokemon that are a lower level than your own.

Liechi Berry.effect: Raises Attack when HP is low.

Life Orb.effect: Increases the power of moves, but loses HP each turn.

Light Ball.effect: An item to be held by PIKACHU. It is a puzzling orb that raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stat.

Light Clay.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of barrier moves like Light Screen and Reflect used by the holder.

Looker Ticket.effect: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It’s decorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

Love Ball.effect: Poke Ball for catching Pokemon that are the opposite gender of your Pokemon.

Lucarionite.effect: Enables Lucario to Mega Evolve during battle.

Luck Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It doubles a battle’s prize money if the holding Pokemon joins in.

Lucky Egg.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is an egg filled with happiness that earns extra Exp. Points in battle.

Lucky Punch.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Chansey.

Lum Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from any status problem.

Lure Ball.effect: A Poke Ball for catching Pokemon hooked by a Rod when fishing.

Lustrous Orb.effect: Increases the power of Dragon-​ and Water-type moves when held by Palkia.

Luxury Ball.effect: A comfortable Poke Ball that makes a caught wild Pokemon quickly grow friendly.

Macho Brace.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is a stiff and heavy brace that promotes strong growth but lowers Speed.

Magmarizer.effect: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma energy. It is loved by a certain Pokemon.

Magnet.effect: Increases the power of Electric-type moves.

Mago Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Magost Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Manectite.effect: Enables Manectric to Mega Evolve during battle.

Master Ball.effect: The best Ball with the ultimate level of performance. It will catch any wild Pokemon without fail.

Mawilite.effect: Enables Mawile to Mega Evolve during battle.

Max Elixir.effect: It fully restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokemon.

Max Ether.effect: It fully restores the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by the target Pokemon.

Max Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It completely restores the HP of a single Pokemon.

Max Repel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokemon from appearing for 250 steps after its use.

Max Revive.effect: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokemon. It fully restores the Pokemon’s HP.

Meadow Plate.effect: Increases power of Grass-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Grass.

Medal Box.effect: A box-shaped machine that stores Medals and Medal information.

Medichamite.effect: Enables Medicham to Mega Evolve during battle.

Mental Herb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It snaps the holder out of infatuation. It can be used only once.

Metal Coat.effect: Increases the power of Steel-type moves.

Metal Powder.effect: Increases Defense when held by Ditto.

Metronome.effect: Increases the power of moves used consecutively.

Mewtwonite X.effect: Enables Mewtwo to Mega Evolve during battle.

Mewtwonite Y.effect: Enables Mewtwo to Mega Evolve during battle.

Micle Berry.effect: Increases a move's accuracy when HP is low.

Mind Plate.effect: Increases power of Psychic-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Psychic.

Miracle Seed.effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves.

Moomoo Milk.effect: Milk with a very high nutrition content. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by 100 points.

Moon Ball.effect: A Poke Ball for catching Pokemon that evolve using the Moon Stone.

Moon Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of POKeMON evolve. It is as black as the night sky.

Muscle Band.effect: Increases the power of Physical-category moves.

Mystic Water.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves.

Nanab Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Nest Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that works especially well on weaker Pokemon in the wild.

Net Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that works especially well on Water- and Bug-type Pokemon.

NeverMeltIce.effect: Increases the power of Ice-type moves.

Nomel Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Normal Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Normal-type move only once.

Nugget.effect: A nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

Occa Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Fire-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Odd Incense.effect: Increases the power of Psychic-type moves.

Odd Keystone.effect: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

Old Amber.effect: A piece of amber that contains the genetic material of an ancient Pokemon. It is clear with a reddish tint.

Old Gateau.effect: Old Chateau’s hidden specialty. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokemon.

Oran Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it heals the user by just 10 HP.

Oval Charm.effect: An oval charm said to increase the chance of Pokemon Eggs being found at the Day Care.

Oval Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokemon evolve. It is shaped like an egg.

Pamtre Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Park Ball.effect: A special Poke Ball for the Pal Park.

Parlyz Heal.effect: A spray-type medicine. It eliminates paralysis from a single Pokemon.

Pass Orb.effect: A mysterious orb containing the power of the Unova region, to be used when generating Pass Power.

Passho Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Water-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Payapa Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Psychic-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Pearl.effect: A somewhat-small pearl that sparkles in a pretty silver color. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

Pearl String.effect: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver color. A maniac will buy them for a high price.

Pecha Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from poison.

Permit.effect: A permit that is needed to enter the Nature Preserve. Not many know about it.

Persim Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from confusion.

Petaya Berry.effect: Raises Special Attack when HP is low.

Pinap Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Pink Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Cute aspect in a Contest.

Pinsirite.effect: Enables Pinsir to Mega Evolve during battle.

Pixie Plate.effect: Increases power of Fairy-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fairy.

Plasma Card.effect: A card key needed to enter the password inside the Plasma Frigate.

Plume Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that flew in the sky in ancient times. It appears to be part of its wing.

Pnk Apricorn.effect: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

Poison Barb.effect: Increases the power of Poison-type moves.

Poison Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Poison-type move only once.

Poke Ball.effect: A device for catching wild Pokemon. It is thrown like a ball at the target. It is designed as a capsule system.

Poke Doll.effect: A doll that attracts Pokemon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokemon.

Poke Toy.effect: An item that attracts Pokemon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokemon.

Pomeg Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base HP.

Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by just 20 points.

Power Anklet.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes Speed gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

Power Band.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes Sp. Def gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

Power Belt.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes Defense gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

Power Bracer.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes Attack gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

Power Herb.effect: A single-use item to be held by a Pokemon. It allows the immediate use of a move that charges on the first turn.

Power Lens.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes Sp. Atk gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

Power Plant Pass.effect: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access to the power plant that lies along Route 13.

Power Weight.effect: A Pokemon held item that promotes HP gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

PP Max.effect: It maximally raises the top PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokemon.

PP Up.effect: It slightly raises the maximum PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokemon.

Premier Ball.effect: A somewhat rare Poke Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

Pretty Wing.effect: Though this feather is beautiful, it’s just a regular feather and has no effect on Pokemon.

Prism Scale.effect: A mysterious scale that evolves certain Pokemon. It shines in rainbow colors.

Prof's Letter.effect: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your mother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to cling to the paper.

Protector.effect: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff and heavy. It is loved by a certain Pokemon.

Protein.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base Attack stat of a single Pokemon.

Psychic Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Psychic-type move only once.

Pure Incense.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It helps keep wild Pokemon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

Qualot Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base Defense stat.

Quick Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that provides a better catch rate if it is used at the start of a wild encounter.

Quick Claw.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.

Quick Powder.effect: Increases Speed when held by Ditto.

Rabuta Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Rare Bone.effect: A bone that is extremely valuable for Pokemon archeology. It can be sold for a high price to shops.

Rare Candy.effect: A candy that is packed with energy. It raises the level of a single Pokemon by one.

Rawst Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it recovers from a burn.

Razor Fang.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It may make foes and allies flinch when the holder inflicts damage.

Razz Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Reaper Cloth.effect: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It is loved by a certain Pokemon.

Red Apricorn.effect: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

Red Card.effect: A card with a mysterious power. When the holder is struck by a foe, the attacker is removed from battle.

Red Flute.effect: A toy flute made from red glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Red Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Cool aspect in a Contest.

Red Shard.effect: A small red shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

Relic Band.effect: A bracelet made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Copper.effect: A copper coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Crown.effect: A crown made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Gold.effect: A gold coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Silver.effect: A silver coin used in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Statue.effect: A stone figure made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Relic Vase.effect: A vase made in a civilization about 3,000 years ago. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Repeat Ball.effect: A somewhat different Poke Ball that works especially well on Pokemon species that were previously caught.

Repel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokemon from appearing for 100 steps after its use.

Reset Urge.effect: When used, it restores any stat changes of an ally Pokemon.

Reveal Glass.effect: A looking glass that reveals the truth. It’s a mysterious glass that returns a Pokemon to its original shape.

Revival Herb.effect: A very bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokemon, fully restoring its HP.

Revive.effect: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokemon. It restores half the Pokemon’s maximum HP.

Rindo Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Grass-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Ring Target.effect: Moves that would otherwise have no effect will land on the Pokemon that holds it.

Rock Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Rock-type move only once.

Rock Incense.effect: Increases the power of Rock-type moves.

Rocky Helmet.effect: If the holder of this item takes damage, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

Roller Skates.effect: Attaches roller skates to the bottom of your shoes, allowing you to glide quickly around and perform tricks.

Root Fossil.effect: A fossil of an ancient Pokemon that lived in the sea. It appears to be part of a plant root.

Rose Incense.effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves.

Rowap Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon and a special attack lands, the attacker also takes damage.

Sacred Ash.effect: It revives all fainted Pokemon. In doing so, it also fully restores their HP.

Safari Ball.effect: A special Poke Ball that is used only in the Great Marsh. It is decorated in a camouflage pattern.

Salac Berry.effect: Raises Speed when HP is low.

Scizorite.effect: Enables Scizor to Mega Evolve during battle.

Sea Incense.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves.

Sharp Beak.effect: Increases the power of Flying-type moves.

Shed Shell.effect: A tough, discarded carapace to be held by a Pokemon. It enables the holder to switch with a waiting Pokemon in battle.

Shell Bell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. The holder’s HP is restored a little every time it inflicts damage.

Shiny Charm.effect: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of finding a Shiny Pokemon in the wild.

Shiny Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokemon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.

Shoal Salt.effect: Pure salt that can be discovered deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Shoal Shell.effect: A pretty seashell that can be found deep inside the Shoal Cave. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Shock Drive.effect: Changes Techno Blast to an Electric-type move when held by Genesect.

Shuca Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ground-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Silk Scarf.effect: Increases the power of Normal-type moves.

SilverPowder.effect: Increases the power of Bug-type moves.

Sitrus Berry.effect: If held by a Pokemon, it heals the user’s HP a little.

Skull Fossil.effect: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokemon that lived on the land. It appears to be part of a head.

Sky Plate.effect: Increases power of Flying-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Flying.

Smoke Ball.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokemon without fail.

Smooth Rock.effect: A Pokemon held item that extends the duration of the move Sandstorm used by the holder.

Soda Pop.effect: A fizzy soda drink. It restores the HP of one POKeMON by 60 points.

Soft Sand.effect: Increases the power of Ground-type moves.

Soothe Bell.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is a bell with a comforting chime that calms the holder and makes it friendly.

Soul Dew.effect: Increases both Special Attack and Special Defense when held by Latios or Latias.

Spell Tag.effect: Increases the power of Ghost-type moves.

Spelon Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Splash Plate.effect: Increases power of Water-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Water.

Spooky Plate.effect: Increases power of Ghost-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ghost.

Sport Ball.effect: A special Poke Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

Sprinklotad.effect: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

Stable Mulch.effect: A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil in regions where Berries are grown. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Star Piece.effect: A shard of a pretty gem that sparkles in a red color. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

Stardust.effect: Lovely, red-colored sand with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

Starf Berry.effect: Sharply raises a random stat when HP is low.

Steel Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Steel-type move only once.

Stick.effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Farfetch'd.

Sticky Barb.effect: A held item that damages the holder on every turn. It may latch on to foes and allies that touch the holder.

Stone Plate.effect: Increases power of Rock-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Rock.

Sun Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of POKeMON evolve. It is as red as the sun.

Super Potion.effect: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by 50 points.

Super Repel.effect: An item that prevents weak wild Pokemon from appearing for 200 steps after its use.

Sweet Heart.effect: Very sweet chocolate. It restores the HP of one Pokemon by only 20 points.

Tamato Berry.effect: Using it on a Pokemon makes it more friendly, but it also lowers its base Speed stat.

Tanga Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Bug-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Thick Club.effect: Increases Attack when held by Cubone or Marowak.

Thunderstone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of POKeMON evolve. It has a thunderbolt pattern.

Timer Ball.effect: A somewhat different BALL that becomes progressively better the more turns there are in a battle.

Tiny Mushroom.effect: A small and rare mushroom. It is sought after by collectors.

TM01.effect: Teaches the move Mega Punch / DynamicPunch / Focus Punch / Hone Claws.

TM02.effect: Teaches the move Razor Wind / Headbutt / Dragon Claw.

TM03.effect: Teaches the move Swords Dance / Curse / Water Pulse / Psyshock.

TM04.effect: Teaches the move Whirlwind / Rollout / Calm Mind.

TM05.effect: Teaches the move Mega Kick / Roar.

TM07.effect: Teaches the move Horn Drill / Zap Cannon / Hail.

TM08.effect: Teaches the move Body Slam / Rock Smash / Bulk Up.

TM09.effect: Teaches the move Take Down / Psych Up / Bullet Seed / Venoshock.

TM10.effect: Teaches the move Double-Edge / Hidden Power.

TM11.effect: Teaches the move BubbleBeam / Sunny Day.

TM12.effect: Teaches the move Water Gun / Sweet Scent / Taunt.

TM13.effect: Teaches the move Snore / Ice Beam.

TM16.effect: Teaches the move Pay Day / Icy Wind / Light Screen.

TM18.effect: Teaches the move Counter / Rain Dance.

TM19.effect: Teaches the move Seismic Toss / Giga Drain / Telekinesis / Roost.

TM20.effect: Teaches the move Rage / Endure / Safeguard.

TM21.effect: Teaches the move Mega Drain / Frustration.

TM23.effect: Teaches the move Dragon Rage / Iron Tail / Smack Down.

TM30.effect: Teaches the move Teleport / Shadow Ball.

TM31.effect: Teaches the move Mimic / Mud-Slap / Brick Break.

TM33.effect: Teaches the move Ice Punch / Reflect.

TM34.effect: Teaches the move Bide / Swagger / Shock Wave / Sludge Wave.

TM35.effect: Teaches the move Metronome / Sleep Talk / Flamethrower.

TM36.effect: Teaches the move Selfdestruct / Sludge Bomb.

TM37.effect: Teaches the move Egg Bomb / Sandstorm.

TM39.effect: Teaches the move Swift / Rock Tomb.

TM40.effect: Teaches the move Skull Bash / Defense Curl / Aerial Ace.

TM41.effect: Teaches the move Softboiled / ThunderPunch / Torment.

TM42.effect: Teaches the move Dream Eater / Facade.

TM43.effect: Teaches the move Sky Attack / Detect / Secret Power / Flame Charge.

TM45.effect: Teaches the move Thunder Wave / Attract.

TM47.effect: Teaches the move Explosion / Steel Wing / Low Sweep.

TM48.effect: Teaches the move Rock Slide / Fire Punch / Skill Swap / Round.

TM49.effect: Teaches the move Tri Attack / Fury Cutter / Snatch / Echoed Voice.

TM50.effect: Teaches the move Substitute / Nightmare / Overheat.

TM51.effect: Teaches the move Roost / Ally Switch / Steel Wing.

TM58.effect: Teaches the move Endure / Sky Drop.

TM59.effect: Teaches the move Dragon Pulse / Incinerate.

TM60.effect: Teaches the move Drain Punch / Quash.

TM62.effect: Teaches the move Silver Wind / Acrobatics.

TM72.effect: Teaches the move Avalanche / Volt Switch.

TM76.effect: Teaches the move Stealth Rock / Struggle Bug.

TM79.effect: Teaches the move Dark Pulse / Frost Breath.

TM82.effect: Teaches the move Sleep Talk / Dragon Tail.

TM83.effect: Teaches the move Natural Gift / Work Up / Infestation.

TM88.effect: Teaches the move Pluck / Sleep Talk.

TMV Pass.effect: A commuter pass that allows the holder to ride the TMV between Lumiose City and Kiloude City at any time.

Toxic Orb.effect: An item to be held by a Pokemon. It is a bizarre orb that badly poisons the holder in battle.

Toxic Plate.effect: Increases power of Poison-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Poison.

TwistedSpoon.effect: Increases the power of Psychic-type moves.

Tyranitarite.effect: Enables Tyranitar to Mega Evolve during battle.

Ultra Ball.effect: An ultra-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokemon catch rate than a Great Ball.

Up-Grade.effect: A transparent device filled with all sorts of data. It was produced by Silph Co.

Venusaurite.effect: Enables Venusaur to Mega Evolve during battle.

Wacan Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Electric-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Water Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Water-type move only once.

Water Stone.effect: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokemon evolve. It is a clear, light blue.

Watmel Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Wave Incense.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves.

Wepear Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

White Flute.effect: A toy flute made from white glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

White Herb.effect: An item to be held by a POKeMON. It restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

Wht Apricorn.effect: A white Apricorn. It doesn’t smell like anything.

Wiki Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Wise Glasses.effect: Increases the power of Special-category moves.

X Accuracy.effect: Raises Accuracy of a Pokemon in battle.

X Accuracy 2.effect: Sharply raises Accuracy of a Pokemon in battle.

X Accuracy 3.effect: Drastically raises Accuracy of a Pokemon in battle.

X Accuracy 6.effect: Immensely raises Accuracy of a Pokemon in battle.

X Attack.effect: Raises Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Attack 2.effect: Sharply raises Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Attack 3.effect: Drastically raises Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Attack 6.effect: Immensely raises Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Defend.effect: Raises Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Defend 2.effect: Sharply raises Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Defend 3.effect: Drastically raises Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Defend 6.effect: Immensely raises Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Sp. Def.effect: Raises Special Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Sp. Def 2.effect: Sharply raises Special Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Sp. Def 3.effect: Drastically raises Special Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Sp. Def 6.effect: Immensely raises Special Defense of a Pokemon in battle.

X Special.effect: Raises Special Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Special 2.effect: Sharply raises Special Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Special 3.effect: Drastically raises Special Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Special 6.effect: Immensely raises Special Attack of a Pokemon in battle.

X Speed.effect: Raises Speed of a Pokemon in battle.

X Speed 2.effect: Sharply raises Speed of a Pokemon in battle.

X Speed 3.effect: Drastically raises Speed of a Pokemon in battle.

X Speed 6.effect: Immensely raises Speed of a Pokemon in battle.

Yache Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ice-type attack against the holding Pokemon.

Yellow Flute.effect: A toy flute made from yellow glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Yellow Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Tough aspect in a Contest.

Yellow Shard.effect: A small yellow shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

Ylw Apricorn.effect: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

Zap Plate.effect: Increases power of Electric-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Electric.

Zinc.effect: A nutritious drink for Pokemon. It raises the base Sp. Def (Special Defense) stat of a single Pokemon.

Zoom Lens.effect: Raises a move's accuracy if the holder moves after its target.
